pr_title: Tag those tests that will fail for Zowe RC

timeline.message:
Tag tests not meant to be run against Zowe RC

Signed-off-by: Jakub Balhar <jakub.balhar@broadcom.com>

Remove unneeded import

Signed-off-by: Jakub Balhar <jakub.balhar@broadcom.com>

Verify whether the tag breaks the test run.

Signed-off-by: Jakub Balhar <jakub.balhar@broadcom.com>

timeline.bodyText: why is this test not running on Zowe?
timeline.author: jandadav

replies.bodyText: I believe that it is because the deployment on CA32 doesn't contain the necessary files
replies.author: balhar-jakub

replies.bodyText: Version endpoints shows versions "Unknown" even files aren't exist.
replies.author: ilkinabdullayev

replies.bodyText: Yes, but then the success path in the tests fails.
replies.author: balhar-jakub

replies.bodyText: Maybe the version test for success would make sense in the Nightly builds? There we have the full Zowe instance.
replies.author: balhar-jakub

timeline.bodyText: this is because when zowe tests are run, a different verification mechanism is used?
timeline.author: jandadav
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -161,7 +161,6 @@ task runAllIntegrationTestsForZoweTesting(type: Test) {
     group "Integration tests"
     description "Run all integration tests for Zowe testing"
 
-    dependsOn startUpCheck

replies.bodyText:
Yes, they are run at the moment by a person and there were issues with the startUpCheck there.
It verifies the availability of the Discoverable Client which isn't in the environment.
replies.author: balhar-jakub

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't web socket tests be excluded?
timeline.author: taban03

replies.bodyText: I excluded all the WebSocket tests on the class level.
replies.author: balhar-jakub
